newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Copper, aluminium seen probing downside.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Copper, aluminium seen probing downside.

text.p: 3 MONTH CLOSE * SUPPORT * RESIST * RSI14 * MA10 * MA30
Three months copper is expected to probe the downside towards support at $2,250 and $2,230 a tonne, but a hefty backwardation should underpin the market, analysts and traders said on Wednesday.
Aluminium was soggy and should also test lower levels, they added.
COPPER -
Three month prices formed a bearish outside day on the charts on Tuesday, closing near their lows at $2,278 after touching a high of $2,337, indicating further downside moves.
Support was pegged at $2,250, the lows of July 10 and 11, and $2,230, the low of July 9. In addition, the 200-day moving average at $2,261 should also help slow any move lower.

But the cash/threes backwardation was still above $200 per tonne and should keep prices from spiralling out of control. It was slightly narrower early on Wednesday, indicated at $225/$240, compared to $240/50 at Tuesday's close.
"Look for further initial weakness, but with the spread remaining firm around $240 back, copper remains vulnerable to upside spikes," said analyst Martin Squires of broker Rudolf Wolff.
Resistance would be seen at the psychological $2,300 mark, then around $2,315/18, at $2,337, Tuesday's peak, and at $2,365, the top of a gap.
"On the upside, a close above $2,302 is needed to relieve downward pressure and target $2,335," said Harry Creates, chartist with broker AMT.
At 0745 GMT three months LME copper was quoted at $2,265/70, down about $15 from Tuesday's late close.
ALUMINIUM -
The market would explore lower levels after shedding $21 on Tuesday but support should kick in at the lower levels.
"A sloppy close indicates a test of the $1,555/60 area," said broker Brandeis in a commentary.
"Reasonable scale-down buying should be seen at these levels, however, and unless there is a breach of support at $1,540, the market is expected to remain in its recent range," Brandeis added.
Other analysts pegged support at $1,542-$1,545 based on the lows of April 14, June 25 and July 9, and at the February 11 low of $1,534.
On the upside, resistance would be seen around $1,585, the top of the recent range before Tuesday's spike higher.
At 0745 GMT three months aluminium was quoted at $1,551/54, down $13 from Tuesday's late close.
--Eric Onstad, London Newsroom +44 171 542-8065
